case_vignette: A 1-month-old infant is brought to the physician for a well-child examination. His mother reports that she had previously breastfed her son every 2 hours for 15 minutes but is now feeding him every 4 hours for 40 minutes. She says that the infant sweats a lot and is uncomfortable during feeds. He has 6 wet diapers and 2 stools daily. He was born at 36 weeks' gestation. He currently weighs 3500 g (7.7 lb) and is 52 cm (20.4 in) in length. He is awake and alert. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), pulse is 170/min, respirations are 55/min, and blood pressure is 80/60 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 99%. Cardiopulmonary examination shows a 4/6 continuous murmur along the upper left sternal border.
question: After confirming the diagnosis via echocardiography, which  is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been sweating a lot and feeling uncomfortable when I eat.
Have you had any chest pain or shortness of breath?
I haven't had any chest pain, but I do breathe faster.
Have you had any history of heart disease or high blood pressure?
I'm just a 1-month-old baby, so I don't have a history like that.
Have you been breastfeeding exclusively?
Yes, I've been exclusively breastfed.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as vomiting or diarrhea?
No, I haven't had any vomiting or diarrhea.
Have you been taking any medications or supplements?
No, I haven't been taking any medications or supplements.
Have you been born prematurely?
Yes, I was born a little early, at 36 weeks.
Final Diagnosis: Congenital Heart Disease.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A 1-month-old baby is brought into the clinic with complaints of excessive sweating and discomfort during feeding. The baby has been exclusively breastfed and has not experienced any vomiting or diarrhea. The baby was born prematurely at 36 weeks and has not been taking any medications or supplements.
trial_0.vignette_frq: Admit the patient to the hospital for further evaluation and management.
trial_0.singleturn_mcq:
**Final Diagnosis:** Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)

**Next Step:** Reassurance and follow-up
